cmatools.cli_hello_world

A “hello-world” Command line application tool

Allows development and testing of a simple command line tool

cmatools.cli_hello_world.build_parser() → argparse.ArgumentParser[source]

Function to build a parser with program details and arguments set

Returns

parser

Return type

argparse.ArgumentParser

cmatools.cli_hello_world.cli_arguments(parser) → argparse.ArgumentParser[source]

Adds cli tool arguments to an existing parser

Parameters

parser (argparse.ArgumentParser) – An argparse parser

Returns

parser – Parser object, with specified arguments

Return type

argparse.ArgumentParser

Function to wrap passing the parsed command line arguments to the analysis function

Parameters

argv (str) – The command line arguments

Returns

Return type

None

cmatools.cli_hello_world.cli_hello(parsed_args) → str[source]

Function to print text to the terminal

Parameters

parsed_args (argparse.Namespace) – The command line arguments parsed into a namespace object

Returns

analysis_product – The result of the multiplication of parsed_args.x and parsed_args.y

Return type

int

cmatools.cli_hello_world.cli_parse_args(argv=None) → argparse.Namespace[source]

Function to parse the passed arguments into an argparse namespace object

Parameters

argv (str) – The arguments from the command line

Returns

parser.parse_args(argv) – The namespace object holding the command line arguments

Return type

argparse.Namespace

Factory function to create parser object for arguments from the command line

cmatools.definitions

Source definitions file to generate constants. Currently used to generate main code source root path and package name for use by other modules
